pullrequest.title: Config and cmake fixes for Windows build

content.raw:
I believe one reason could be that qt uses some internal settings to resolve its own library dependencies when it's linked against and that an ORIGIN path gets set when it's installed. I did do some searching around on this but couldn't find any definitive documentation. I also could be completely wrong about this.

Update:
This SO answer describes the issue http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4699311/how-to-install-qt-on-windows-after-building

A note from the post:
*The bottom line:
The build process of Qt under Windows makes it really akward to move (install) Qt after building. You should do this only if ... well I can't find any good reason to go through all this trouble.*
content.html:
I believe one reason could be that qt uses some internal settings to resolve its own library dependencies when it's linked against and that an ORIGIN path gets set when it's installed. I did do some searching around on this but couldn't find any definitive documentation. I also could be completely wrong about this.

Update: This SO answer describes the issue http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4699311/how-to-install-qt-on-windows-after-building

A note from the post: The bottom line: The build process of Qt under Windows makes it really akward to move (install) Qt after building. You should do this only if ... well I can't find any good reason to go through all this trouble.
